definitions.definition: Equal to the end proposed; adequate to what is needed; enough
definitions.example: There is not sufficient access to the internet in many small rural villages.

definitions.definition: Possessing adequate talents or accomplishments; of competent power or ability; qualified; fit.
definitions.example: A two-week training course is sufficient to get a job in the coach-driving profession.

definitions.definition: Having enough money to meet obligations and live comfortably.
